abilities.name: Flare Condition
abilities.text: As long as Arcanine has any Fire Energy attached to it, Arcanine has no Weakness.

attacks.name: Burn Out
attacks.text: You may do 30 damage plus 30 more damage. If you do, Arcanine is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flames of Rage
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to Arcanine. This attack does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Arcanine.

attacks.name: Bounce Back
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Smack Attack
attacks.text: Remove 1 damage counter from Bastiodon GL.

abilities.name: Eerie Aura
abilities.text: Put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon that remains Asleep between turns.

attacks.name: Darkness Sleep
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, that Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Giant Wave
attacks.text: Floatzel GL can't use Giant Wave during your next turn.

abilities.name: Rainbow Float
abilities.text: If any basic Energy card attached to Flygon is the same type as any of your Pokémon, the Retreat Cost for those Pokémon is 0.

attacks.name: Sand Wall
attacks.text: Discard a Stadium card your opponent has in play. If you do, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Flygon during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Power Swing
attacks.text: Does 60 damage plus 10 more damage for each Evolved Pokémon on your Bench.

attacks.name: Sleep Inducer
attacks.text: Switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Wake-Up Slap
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by any Special Conditions, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage. Then, remove all Special Conditions from the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Final Wish
abilities.text: Once during your opponent's turn, if Jirachi would be Knocked Out by damage from an attack, you may search your deck for any 1 card and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. 0 Detour If you have a Supporter card in play, use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.

attacks.name: Swift
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Boundary Aura
abilities.text: Apply Weakness for each Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) as ×2 instead.

attacks.name: Combo Throw
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Trash Bolt
attacks.text: Discard an Energy card from your hand. (If you can't discard a card from your hand, this attack does nothing.)

attacks.name: Psychic Removal
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, discard all Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grudge
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

attacks.name: Trample
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). If that coin flip is heads, this attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

attacks.name: Poison Bind
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned and can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Long Whip
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is affected by any Special Conditions, you may do 30 damage to any 1 Benched Pokémon instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Unlucky Wind
abilities.text: As long as Shiftry is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent flips a coin during his or her turn, treat it as tails.

attacks.name: Conform
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Seal Off
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't use any Poké-Powers or Poké-Bodies during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Return Blow
attacks.text: If Aggron was damaged by an attack during your opponent's last turn, this attack does the same amount of damage done to Aggron to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Metal Fang
attacks.text: You may discard the top card of your deck. If you do, remove 2 damage counters and all Special Conditions from Aggron.

abilities.name: Flutter Wings
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may search your deck for a Grass Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. This power can't be used if Beedrill is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Needle Shock
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and Poisoned. Ignore this effect if any of your Pokémon used Needle Shock during your last turn.

attacks.name: Payback
attacks.text: If your opponent has only 1 Prize card left, this attack does 10 damage plus 50 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Hypnosis
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Psywave
attacks.text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Undevelop
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may devolve Flareon and put Flareon into your hand. This power can't be used if Flareon is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Evolving Flare
attacks.text: If Flareon evolved from Eevee during this turn, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage and the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Chop Up
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

abilities.name: Sticky Hold

attacks.name: Muddy Bomb

attacks.name: Raging Sea

attacks.name: Groundquake

attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

abilities.name: Maternal Comfort

attacks.name: Ruthless Tail

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Snorlax from your hand onto Munchlax (this counts as evolving Munchlax) and remove all damage counters from Munchlax.

attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Grind

abilities.name: Camouflage Gas

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Aaron's Collection
rules: Search your discard pile for up to 2 in any combination of Pokémon SP and basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Bebe's Search
rules: Choose a card from your hand and put it on top of your deck. Search your deck for a Pokémon, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. (If this is the only card in your hand, you can't play this card.)
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Bertha's Warmth
rules: Remove 5 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon SP.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Flint's Willpower
rules: Attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon SP.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Lucian's Assignment
rules: Move as many Energy cards attached to 1 of your Pokémon as you like to another of your Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Pokémon Contest Hall
rules: You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Sunyshore City Gym
rules: Any damage done by attacks from Lightning Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) to the Defending Pokémon isn't affected by Resistance. Each Lightning Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's) has no Weakness.
You may play only 1 Stadium card during your turn. Put it next to the Active Spot, and discard it if another Stadium comes into play. A Stadium with the same name can't be played.

name: Team Galactic's Invention G

attacks.name: Damage Porter
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on the Pokémon this card is attached to to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Illustrated by Makoto Imai More formats

rules: Attach this card to 1 of your Pokémon SP in play. That Pokémon may use this card's attack instead of its own. When the Pokémon this card is attached to is no longer Pokémon SP, discard this card.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Team Galactic's Invention G
rules: Choose a card from your hand and put it on top of your deck. Search your deck for a Pokémon SP, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward. (If this is the only card in your hand, you can't play this card.)
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

name: Underground Expedition
rules: Look at the bottom 4 cards of your deck and put 2 of them into your hand. Put the other cards back on the bottom of your deck in any order.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Volkner's Philosophy
rules: You may discard a card from your hand. Then, draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. (If you can't draw any cards, you can't play this card.)
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

name: Metal Energy
rules: Damage done by attacks to the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance). Ignore this effect if the Pokémon that Metal Energy is attached to isn't Metal. Metal Energy provides Metal Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

name: SP Energy
rules: SP Energy provides Colorless Energy. If the Pokémon SP Energy is attached to is a Pokémon SP, SP Energy provides every type of Energy buy provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

name: Upper Energy
rules: Upper Energy provides Colorless Energy. If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent and this card is attached to a Pokémon (excluding Pokémon LV.X), Upper Energy provides ColorlessColorless.

abilities.name: Damage Switch
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move 1 damage counter from 1 of your Pokémon SP to another of your Pokémon SP. This power can't be used if Alakazam E4 is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Mind Shock
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

abilities.name: Water Rescue
abilities.text: Whenever any of your Water Pokémon (excluding any Floatzel GL) is Knocked Out by damage from your opponent's attack, you may put that Pokémon and all cards that were attached to it from your discard pile into your hand.

attacks.name: Energy Cyclone
attacks.text: Choose as many Energy cards from your hand as you like and show them to your opponent. This attack does 20 damage times the number of Energy cards you chose. Put those Energy cards on top of your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.

abilities.name: Wind Erosion
abilities.text: As long as Flygon is your Active Pokémon, discard the top card from your opponent's deck between turns.

attacks.name: Extreme Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon LV.X. This attack does 150 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon).

abilities.name: Blade Storm
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Gallade E4 LV.X from your hand onto your Active Gallade E4, you may put 1 damage counter on each of your opponent's Pokémon.

attacks.name: Aimed Cut
attacks.text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Sand Reset
abilities.text: Once during a game on your turn (before your attack), each player shuffles all cards in play (excluding Pokémon and Supporter cards) into his or her deck. You can't use more than 1 Sand Reset Poké-Power each game.

attacks.name: Double Shoot
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fighting Energy attached to Hippowdon and choose 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to each of them. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Intimidating Roar
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon. This power can't be used if Infernape E4 is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Fire Spin
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to Infernape E4.

abilities.name: Bright Look
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), when you put Luxray GL LV.X from your hand onto your Active Luxray GL, you may switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Flash Impact
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your Pokémon, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

abilities.name: Magical Return
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may return a Pokémon Tool or Technical Machine card attached to your Pokémon to your hand. This power can't be used if Mismagius GL is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Darkness Magic
attacks.text: Count the number of cards in your hand. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon. You can't put more than 8 damage counters in this way.

abilities.name: Big Appetite
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Snorlax is your Active Pokémon, you may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand. If you do, Snorlax is now Asleep. This power can't be used if Snorlax is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Exercise
attacks.text: You may discard as many Energy cards as you like from your hand. If you do, remove that many damage counters from Snorlax.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Pikachu does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Fly
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, during your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Flying Pikachu; if tails, this attack does nothing (not even damage).
